p: The Pearson correlation coefficient (r) between the essential oil contents of different studied samples indicated that Fc had a highly significant positive correlation with Ft (r = 0.71), Fk (r = 0.58), Fv (r = 0.47) and Fp (r = 0.35), while a non-significant negative correlation was observed between Fc and Fs (the highest correlations were observed between Ft and Fk (r = 0.89, p < 0.001), between Fc and Ft (r = 0.71, p < 0.001), and between Fc and Fk (r = 0.58, p < 0.001) as seen in Table 2. These data indicate that three samples, Ft, Fk, and Fc have highly similar essential oil content.
